meanings.definition: Having a finished edge on a woven fabric to prevent unraveling.
meanings.sent1: The selvedged fabric looked neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using selvedged materials for my sewing projects.
meanings.sent3: The selvedged edge was so perfect, it almost seemed magical.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was like a selvedged border, keeping everything in place.
meanings.sent5: The selvedged finish added a touch of elegance to the garment.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a self-finished edge.
meanings.sent1: The store had a variety of selvedged fabrics on display.
meanings.sent2: She loved the soft texture of the selvedged material.
meanings.sent3: The selvedged fabric whispered tales of its impeccable quality.
meanings.sent4: The selvedged cloth was a treasure among the other fabrics.
meanings.sent5: The selvedged edge gave the fabric a unique charm.

meanings.definition: To finish the edge of a fabric to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selvedged the edges of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: I need to selvedge this fabric before sewing it.
meanings.sent3: He selvedged the fabric with precision, like a master craftsman.
meanings.sent4: The tailor selvedged the garment, ensuring its durability.
meanings.sent5: Selvedging the edges made the fabric look professionally done.
